diseases.medications: There is no cure for HPV, but treatment can help manage symptoms like genital warts. Regular cervical cancer screenings are important for women to detect abnormal cells caused by HPV.

diseases.name: Hepatitis B
diseases.description: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that can be transmitted through sexual contact, sharing needles, or from mother to child during childbirth.
diseases.signs: Signs of hepatitis B may include fever, fatigue, abdominal pain, and jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes).
diseases.symptoms: Some people with hepatitis B may not experience any symptoms, but if left untreated, it can lead to liver damage, cirrhosis, and liver cancer.
diseases.preventions: Using condoms during sexual activity can greatly reduce your risk of contracting hepatitis B. The hepatitis B vaccine can also help prevent infection.
diseases.medications: Antiviral medications can help manage hepatitis B and reduce the risk of liver damage. In some cases, a liver transplant may be necessary.

diseases.name: HIV/AIDS
diseases.description: HIV (human immunodeficiency virus) is a virus that attacks the immune system, and can lead to AIDS (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome) if left untreated.
diseases.signs: Early signs of HIV infection can include flu-like symptoms such as fever, headache, and fatigue. In later stages, symptoms may include weight loss, night sweats, and swollen lymph nodes.
diseases.symptoms: HIV can be present in the body for years without causing any symptoms, which is why it's important to get tested regularly if you are sexually active.
diseases.preventions: Using condoms during sexual activity can greatly reduce your risk of contracting HIV. Other prevention methods include pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) and post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP).
diseases.medications: There is no cure for HIV, but antiretro.

diseases.name: Shigellosis
diseases.description: Shigellosis, also known as bacillary dysentery, is a bacterial infection that affects the digestive system. It is caused by a group of bacteria called Shigella.
diseases.signs: Symptoms of shigellosis may include diarrhea, abdominal pain and cramps, fever, and nausea.
diseases.symptoms: The symptoms of shigellosis can vary from person to person. Some people may only experience mild diarrhea, while others may have severe symptoms such as bloody diarrhea, dehydration, and weight loss.
diseases.preventions: Washing your hands regularly, avoiding contaminated food and water, and practicing safe sex can help prevent shigellosis.
diseases.medications: Antibiotics are often prescribed to treat shigellosis. In some cases, the infection may resolve on its own without treatment.

diseases.name: Chancroid
diseases.description: Chancroid is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) that is caused by the bacterium Haemophilus ducreyi. It is most common in developing countries, but it can occur anywhere.
diseases.signs: Symptoms of chancroid may include painful, open sores or ulcers on the genitals or in the groin area. The sores may be accompanied by swelling and tenderness.
diseases.symptoms: Chancroid can cause painful, open sores or ulcers on the genitals or in the groin area. The sores may bleed or ooze fluid, and they can be accompanied by swelling and tenderness. In some cases, chancroid can cause fever and swollen lymph nodes.
diseases.preventions: Practicing safe sex, using condoms during sexual activity, and avoiding sexual contact with someone who has an active infection can help prevent chancroid.
diseases.medications: Antibiotics are often prescribed to treat chancroid. The infection may also be treated with pain relievers and warm compresses.

diseases.name: Donovanosis
diseases.description: Donovanosis, also known as granuloma inguinale, is a bacterial infection that is typically spread through sexual contact. It is caused by the bacterium Klebsiella granulomatis.
diseases.signs: Symptoms of donovanosis may include small, painless bumps or ulcers on the genitals, groin, or anal area. The bumps may grow in size and become more numerous over time.
diseases.symptoms: Donovanosis can cause small, painless bumps or ulcers on the genitals, groin, or anal area. The bumps may grow in size and become more numerous over time. In some cases, donovanosis can cause fever, chills, and swollen lymph nodes.
diseases.preventions: Practicing safe sex and using condoms during sexual activity can help prevent donovanosis. Avoiding sexual contact with someone who has an active infection is also important.
diseases.medications: Antibiotics are often prescribed to treat donovanosis. The infection may also be treated with topical medications and wound care.

diseases.name: Scabies
diseases.description: Scabies is a contagious skin condition caused by a mite that burrows into the skin and lays eggs. The infestation can cause intense itching and a rash, which can become infected if scratched.
diseases.signs: Intense itching, especially at night,Pimple-like bumps,Tracks or burrows in the skin
diseases.symptoms: Intense itching, especially at night,Pimple-like bumps,Tracks or burrows in the skin
diseases.preventions: Avoid close contact with infected people, Wash bedding, clothing, and towels in hot water,Vacuum carpets and furniture regularly
diseases.medications: Permethrin cream,Ivermectin,Crotamiton cream

diseases.name: Trichomoniasis
diseases.description: Trichomoniasis is a common sexually transmitted infection caused by a protozoan parasite. Many people with trichomoniasis have no symptoms, but it can cause discharge, itching, and burning in the genital area.
diseases.signs: Vaginal discharge,Genital itching,Pain during sex
diseases.symptoms: Vaginal discharge,Genital itching,Pain during sex
diseases.preventions: Use condoms during sex,Limit the number of sexual partners,Get regular STD testing
diseases.medications: Metronidazole,Tinidazole

diseases.name: Genital herpes
diseases.description: Genital herpes is a common sexually transmitted infection caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV). It can cause painful blisters and sores on or around the genitals, as well as flu-like symptoms.
diseases.signs: Painful blisters or sores on or around the genitals,Flu-like symptoms, such as fever and swollen lymph nodes,Pain or burning during urination
diseases.symptoms: Painful blisters or sores on or around the genitals,Flu-like symptoms, such as fever and swollen lymph nodes,Pain or burning during urination
diseases.preventions: Use condoms during sex,Limit the number of sexual partners,Avoid sexual contact during outbreaks
diseases.medications: Antiviral medications, such as acyclovir, valacyclovir, and famciclovir
